Docs.summary: Interface for classes whose instances can be written to and restored from a .

remarks.para: A typical implementation of Parcelable is:

Docs.summary: Bit masks for use with : each bit represents a kind of object considered to have potential special significance when marshalled.

remarks.para: Bit masks for use with : each bit represents a kind of object considered to have potential special significance when marshalled.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.ParcelableWriteFlags ParcelableWriteReturnValue = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.OS.ParcelableWriteFlags enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Flag for use with : the object being written is a return value, that is the result of a function such as "Parcelable someFunction()", "void someFunction(out Parcelable)", or "void someFunction(inout Parcelable)".

remarks.para: Flag for use with : the object being written is a return value, that is the result of a function such as "Parcelable someFunction()", "void someFunction(out Parcelable)", or "void someFunction(inout Parcelable)". Some implementations may want to release resources at this point.
